goal.ch: 過去的歷史並沒有消失， 而是以另一種形式顯現在當代人們的生活日常、情感心態與制度習俗中。在不同情境下，人們對過去的歷史記憶，有時刻意遺忘，有時重新塑造；這些有關歷史的過濾方式，深刻形塑地方的樣貌與意義，並影響人群關係。 爲理解當代如何看待過去的歷史，以及歷史如何建構當代的生活，本課程將結合縱向時間與橫向空間維度，從具體的地方空間中理解”歷史”在當代的作用與意義，以掌握當代的”歷史意識與再現”。本課程主要引導同學對於歷史人類學作爲一門學問的主要理論以及實際田野調查能力的認識，以增進歷史教育作爲一門反思與實踐學問的培養。
goal.en: Contemporary people reflect the past in their daily lives, emotional attitudes, and customs.. The past profoundly shapes the form and significance of local society and affects ethical relationships. To understand how people view history and how history constructs daily life today, this course will connect vertical time and horizontal spatial dimensions to explore the role and significance of “history“ in contemporary society from a specific locality, to master modern “historical consciousness and reproduction“. Students will learn about the fundamental theories and practical fieldwork skills of historical anthropology in this course to enhance their education in history..

outline.ch:
本課程介紹歷史人類學的相關理念，主要以華南研究爲參考架構。並以田野與社區為個案，培養參與觀察與分析能力，並與文獻史料對話。希望同學能結合課堂所用的理論，回到實際田野中進行互動與討論，深化理論思維能力與運用。主要內容如下:
1.導言: 歷史人類學的視角
2.地方知識—意義之網
3.地方建構—村落裡的文化與權力
4.社群關係與邊界
5.族群與地域認同
6.地方經濟體與產業
7      宗族與控產集團
8.作為地域社群的宗族社會:
9.田野裡的歷史: 參與觀察與口述訪問
10.   歷史裡的田野---古文書與碑銘解讀
11.    田野調查計畫(初稿提交)
12    宗教與地域的表徵
13.儀式與社區: 儀式的政治與政治的儀式
14.   歷史記憶與敘事
15.地方傳說與再現
16.走進田野---田野實地考察
17.   “地方“紀錄片觀看
18    期末報告分享與討論
outline.en:
We will divide this course into two parts: The first part introduces the relevant concepts and theory of historical anthropology.  The second part will explore Taiwan as a case study, leading students to engage in fieldwork and dialogue with historical materials. The main content is as follows:
1.Introduction: From the Perspective of Historical Anthropology
2. Local Knowledge - Web of Meaning
3. Making Place - Culture and Power in Villages
4. Community and its’ boundaries
5. Ethnic and Identity
6. Local systems and Industries
7 Lineage and Property Control Group
8 Lineage as a territorial unit
9. History in the Field: Participating in Observations and Skills
10. Fields in History - Interpretation of local texts
11. Religion and Representation of Place
12. Rites and Communities: Politics of Rites and Political Rites
13. Historical Memory and Narration
14. Local Legend and Reproduction
15. Entering the Field
17 Documentary of Case Study on Local Society
18 Final Report:  Sharing and Discussion

gradMethod.ch:
1.本課程將隨堂發放文章講義，請事先閱讀，並輪流於課堂上報告與討論。負責報告同學繳交摘要筆記約1-2頁，且發放給同學。期初繳交田野計畫初稿(與書單)，期末完成田野調查報告並分享。

2.出席與討論(30％)/ 讀書報告 (30％)/  田野調查期末報告 (40％)
gradMethod.en: Attendance and classroom discussions (30％)/Reading summary comments (30％)/Field survey records and reports (40％)
